sentences.english: There's no better way to be on the same wave-length than to use Esperanto.
sentences.chinese: 使用世界語是保持同一波長的最好辦法。

sentences.english: As a Esperantist, I am just a beginner.
sentences.chinese: 作爲世界語者，我僅僅是個初學者。

sentences.english: I used to learn more than eight, including Esperanto .
sentences.chinese: 我曾學過八種，包種世界語。

sentences.english: Remember, in Esperanto: one letter - one sound. No exceptions.
sentences.chinese: 世界語中每個字母有一個單獨的發音，沒有例外。

sentences.english: As I learn Esperanto by my-self.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我是自學世界語的。

sentences.english: These meetings are carried on entirely in Esperanto.
sentences.chinese: 這些會議全用世界語進行。

sentences.english: Esperanto was created by L. L.
sentences.chinese: 世界語是波蘭猶太裔眼科醫生L。

sentences.english: An artificial language based on esperanto and ido.
sentences.chinese: 一種以世界語和伊多語爲基礎的人工語。

sentences.english: He teaches Esperanto at that university.
sentences.chinese: 他在那所大學教世界語。
這博客是用世界語寫的。

sentences.english: There's no better example of outreach program than Esperanto.
sentences.chinese: 再沒有比世界語更好的推廣計劃的例子了。

sentences.english: Because you can understand my song, which written in Esperanto.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你能夠理解我用世界語寫的歌。
人們爲什麼要學世界語？
